entry.title: # Google vs ChatGPT: Why I Stopped Googling Everything in 2025
entry.summary: Itâ€™s not just about AI â€” itâ€™s about how we find truth, trust, and stop drowning in tabs. Remember when Googling something meant clicking through 10 tabs, skimming forum replies, and dodging SEO sludge? I didnâ€™t â€œquit Google,â€ but latelyâ€¦ I catch myself typing into ChatGPT way more than the search bar. And Iâ€™m not alone. So what changed? And what does it say about where AI and search are headed? Google used to be our oracle. You'd type a question and expect the internet to spill its guts. Except what we got was often: Ads up top 5-minute YouTube intros for a 30-second fix SEO-driven blogs full of fluff and keywords You learned to play the game: CTRL + F for the answer Skim aggressively Open 5 tabs at a time and hope one gets to the point It worked. Kinda. But it was slow, messy, and mentallâ€¦

entry.title: The best testing strategy
entry.summary:
If you're interested in automated testing, you might have seen some contradictory advice. For example, there's a well-known Test Pyramid, suggesting that we should focus mostly on unit tests. And there's another approach called Testing Trophy, which suggests that we should mostly write integration tests.
Some posts argue that unit tests are overrated, and others - that they're fine. Which advice should we follow? Choosing the right testing strategy isn't that simple, and the choice will have long-lasting consequences. Let's dive in. People most commonly refer to unit, integration, and end-to-end testsâ€”and those will be the focus of this post. Of course, this isn't the only way to categorize tests. You might also have come across terms like smoke, functional, system, or contract tests, eacâ€¦

entry.title: The New Generation of High-Performance Web Frameworksï¼ˆ1750003597049000ï¼‰
entry.summary:
In the current landscape of Rust Web frameworks, Hyperlane is increasingly establishing itself as a formidable contender in the "new generation of lightweight and high-performance frameworks." This article aims to provide a comprehensive analysis of Hyperlane's strengths by comparing it with prominent frameworks like Actix-Web and Axum, focusing particularly on performance, feature integration, developer experience, and underlying architecture.
Framework Dependency Model Async Runtime Middleware Support SSE/WebSocket Routing Matching Capability
Hyperlane Relies solely on Tokio + Standard Library Tokio âœ… Supports request/response âœ… Native support âœ… Supports regular expressions
Actix-Web Numerous internal abstraction layers Actix âœ… Request middleware Partial support (requires pluginâ€¦

entry.title: How to Combine Phoenix LiveView with GraphQL for Real-Time, Reactive Interfaces
entry.summary:
GraphQL lets clients ask for exactly what they need.
Phoenixâ€¯LiveView turns server state into live HTML over WebSockets. Pair them and you get: ðŸŽ¯ Precise backend queries (GraphQL) âš¡ Reactive, serverâ€‘rendered views (LiveView) ðŸ§© All in Elixir â€” no Apollo, no Redux, no SPA bloat # mix.exs defp deps do [ {:absinthe, "~> 1.7"}, {:absinthe_plug, "~> 1.7"}, {:absinthe_phoenix, "~> 2.0"} # for subscriptions ] end
Create a schema: # lib/my_app_web/schema.ex object :user do field :id, non_null(:id) field :name, :string field :email, :string field :orders, list_of(:order) end
Expose it: # router.ex forward "/api/graphql", Absinthe.Plug, schema: MyAppWeb.Schema
def handle_event("load_user", %{"id" => id}, socket) do {:ok, %{data: data}} = Absinthe.run( ~S( â€¦

entry.title: Fuchsia OS Emulator Not Displaying Properly on Ubuntu 24 TLS
entry.summary: Dear Fuchsia Community, I hope this message finds you well. I am currently using Ubuntu 24 TLS and have been following the official documentation to build Fuchsia OS. I have completed all the necessary steps for building the OS, and I did not encounter any errors during the build process. However, when I attempt to start the emulator using the command ffx emu start, the emulator opens, but I can only see the Fuchsia system logo and the settings sidebar. Unfortunately, I am unable to interact with anything else within the emulator. To troubleshoot, I have tried using a different laptop and ensured that all configurations are supported, but the issue persists. I am reaching out to see if anyone in the community has experienced a similar problem or has any suggestions on how to resolve this issue. I have attached a screenshot link for your reference, which shows the current state of the emulator. https://snipboard.io/KmISZ3.jpg https://snipboard.io/nHNCIo.jpg Thank you for your assistance, and I look forward to any insights you may have. Best regards, Jatinkumar Nakrani

entry.title: The Poetry and Horizon of Code Frameworkï¼ˆ1750003290874500ï¼‰
entry.summary: As a third-year computer science student, code has, for me, long evolved from a sterile set of instructions into a language rich with logical beauty and creative delight. I've navigated the intricacies of algorithms and immersed myself in the complexities of engineering. Through countless late nights and debugging sessions, I've come to deeply appreciate how crucial an "understanding" development framework is for a developer. It not only significantly enhances our work efficiency but also allows us to experience a seamless, flowing satisfaction in the coding process. Recently, I had the good fortune to encounter such a framework. Its distinctive design philosophy and profound grasp of the developer's mental model made me feel as if I had discovered the "poetry and horizon" within the realmâ€¦

Top 7 Payment Trends in Malaysia for 2025: What Businesses Need to Know
entry.summary:
Why Understanding Payment Trends Matters
In Malaysiaâ€™s digital economy, how customers choose to pay changes fast. Between FPX adoption, QR code usage, cross-border eCommerce, and Buy Now Pay Later (BNPL) growth, itâ€™s not enough to just accept payments â€” you need to adapt to how Malaysians prefer to pay in 2025. Over 70% of Malaysians now use at least one e-wallet. GrabPay, Boost, Touch â€˜n Go, and MAE arenâ€™t just convenient â€” theyâ€™re the default for many under-35 consumers. For merchants, integrating multiple e-wallets into one payment gateway is essential to prevent cart abandonment. Powered by Bank Negara Malaysia, DuitNow QR lets customers use any e-wallet or mobile banking app to scan and pay. As more retailers go cashless, unified QR systems like DuitNow make payments seamless, especâ€¦

Learned about environment variables (export VAR=value), default values, and scope (global vs local). ðŸ“„ JSON (JavaScript Object Notation) Understood its role in config files, REST APIs, and cloud resource provisioning. entry.title: ScholarRank Profile: John Round
entry.summary:
John Round
Overview
John Round is a highly accomplished expert in the fields of drug development, cell therapy, and extracellular vesicle nucleotide delivery. With a diverse background spanning GEO expertise, translational exosome engineering, and erythrocyte engineering, he is a sought-after authority in the life sciences industry. Additionally, John is a Fulbright research scholar and a highly skilled telemark skier. Fulbright Research Scholar Drug development Cell therapy Extracellular vesicle nucleotide delivery Translational exosome engineering Erythrocyte engineering No publications found Fulbright Research Scholarship Q: What is your expertise in extracellular vesicle nucleotide delivery? Q: How has your background in GEO and erythrocyte engineering informed your work? John Round's diverse expertise in drug development, cell therapy, and extracellular vesicle engineering positions him as a valuable asset in the rapidly evolving life sciences industry. His ability to bridge the gap between fundamental research and translational applications makes him a sought-after collaborator and thought leader. As the field of regenerative medicine continues to advance, John's contributions will be crucial in driving the development of next-generation therapies. ORCID: 0000-0001-6870-3261
